column1: back of a length, angling across to off stump, opens up a little to try and work it leg side, but he's working against the angle and decides to defend instead
ooh, that's a loose shot. Fuller, but still on a good length, and a lot wider. Throws an angled bat at it and he's lucky not to edge that
length ball on off stump, uses his wrists to work it into the backward square leg region
back of a length, fifth-stump line, steep bounce. Amla lifts his bat high over his head to ensure the ball's safe passage through to the keeper
too straight, stays onto Amla's hip, and he tucks it away easily to the fine leg boundary. The fielder there is pretty fine, but not fine enough
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
full again, a bit of late swing in to the left-hander, towards leg stump. Gets his front foot out of the way in time and clips to mid-on
too straight. A full one straying onto the pads, and de Kock works it nice and fine, and fine leg once again has no chance
back of a length, angling into middle and leg. Clipped to midwicket

bowled him, stumps flying all over the place! He's been looking for that full one angling in towards leg stump all through the over, and he bowls another. De Kock leaves a bit of a hole in his attempted on-drive - the result of his front foot not really getting forward at all - and the ball simply bursts through. Judging by how the rest of the over's gone, a definite plan from Boult - something to do with de Kock's lack of feet movement early on, and maybe the angle that his bat comes down at, from around gully or thereabouts

gets a full one first up, outside off, and he gets a good stride out to drive with an open face to the left of extra-cover. Big mix-up between the batsmen - not sure when exactly, because the TV pictures are a complete muddle - but Faf dives and makes his ground in time to beat his throw to the keeper
fullish outside off, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, hops in the air and defends towards backward point
in the blockhole close to off stump, jams down without too much fuss and keeps it out
length ball, quite wide outside off. No real front-foot stride to drive through the covers, and he sends a thick inside edge running away towards fine leg instead
full, angling into middle and leg, keeps his front leg out of the way and shows the full face to block it back to the bowler
ooh, that's a tight leave. On the shorter side of a good length, with a bit of nip back in. Doesn't seem to miss the top of off stump by much
short, but on a tight line close to off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and just meets it with a vertical bat to send it rolling away between backward point and cover point
length ball, slanting away a touch wider. Left alone
shortish, at the body. Whipped off the hip to fine leg
wide length ball, left alone. Could have been called wide, but isn't
nicely bowled. Not quite as wide as the previous one, and on a length that's juuust short of drive-able. Two slips in place, and Faf ignores the bait
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
another wide-ish length ball - sixth stump or thereabouts - and Amla leaves it alone
ooh, some swing on this occasion. On the fuller side of a good length, inviting the cover drive away from the body. Amla goes for it, and the ball swerves past his outside edge

full, angling into off stump. Amla looks for the cover drive, a hands shot with feet going nowhere. The ball doesn't swing this time - he's playing for swing - and it runs away through midwicket off the inside edge. Big gap between bat and pad - that could easily have gone through
length ball outside off, a bit of outswing. Faf leaves it alone
a touch shorter, swerves away sharply from a fifth-stump line, left alone
and again, no shot offered. Back of a length outside off, a bit of away swing

Ooh, that's some sharp inswing. A fullish length, and once again Amla's front foot goes nowhere. Tries to flick it hurriedly, following the swing, but his front pad is in the way. No appeal - the impact was outside leg stump and the ball was missing leg too
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball on middle and off, shuffles across and defends into the on side
looks for that full inswinger again, ends up a touch too straight, and Amla clips it off his toes to the left of fine leg
length ball, straightens a little along the fourth-stump line. Defended off the front foot, into the covers
length ball swinging in towards middle and off. Gets behind it and clips to square leg
fullish on off stump, du Plessis plays a good-looking checked drive to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, did that keep a tiny bit low? Du Plessis jams his bat down quickly and jabs towards midwicket, off the inside half of the bat
length ball swinging away lavishly, but the initial line is wide enough for du Plessis not to get drawn into playing at it
length ball, fifth-stump line, not as much swing - more a hit-the-deck type of ball. Du Plessis leaves again

ooh, that's a good ball. Full, fuller than half-volley length, and it swings away late from just outside off. Du Plessis was looking for a drive through mid-on, and he ended up opened up and edging thickly to the left of third man, where Lockie Ferguson makes a good attempt at a diving save. Looks like he's juuust kept it in with a strong swish of his left hand
length ball outside off, and again that shape away. Left alone
fullish, slanting into a wide-ish line outside off. Left alone again
length ball close to off stump, stays on the crease and pokes into the covers

shot! Given that Amla doesn't really get on the front foot to most deliveries, bowlers can occasionally try and go fuller to try and draw him forward. This one's got a bit of width on it, though, and not much swing back in, and Amla waves his wand of a bat at it - it's a diagonal bat, but does it matter when he connects so cleanly? - and sends it racing away through cover point
bam. Overpitches, on off stump, and Amla just shows it the full face and finds the gap to the right of mid-off
length ball angling across towards off stump, gets across and behind it and defends into the covers

ooh, good ball. Good length, slanting across into the corridor, and gets some extra bounce. Takes the shoulder of the bat as Amla props half-forward to defend, but he plays with soft hands and it doesn't carry to the fielder at slip
another good-length outswinger, sixth-stump line, left alone
good length again, closer to off stump. Judges it well and leaves it again
third leave in a row. Slightly fuller than the previous ball, on a tight line outside off. Sees the shape on it and leaves it
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to the left of square leg, where the fielder makes a good diving stop
length ball outside off, left alone

full outside off, and that's a good shot even though it isn't off the middle of the bat. It isn't a half-volley, and it's swinging back in, but du Plessis got a big stride forward, ensuring he reduced the width of the swing at the point of impact, and the ball rolled away to the right of mid-off off the inside half of the bat
length ball, straightens a bit outside off, not enough to make Faf play
shot! A touch overpitched this time, but again a big stride forward to ensure he's close to the pitch, and he drives between mid-off and short extra-cover
length ball, fifth-stump line. Presses forward, lets it come, and dabs to the left of backward point
shortish, off-stump line. Jumps to ride the bounce and defends towards midwicket

beauty. He's been getting consistent swing back into the right-hander, and this one just keeps going with the angle. Back of a length, pitching within the stumps and slanting away, and it beats the outside edge as Amla aims a back-foot punch at it
full and largely holds its line outside off, Faf presses forward and drives only as far as backward point
on a good length and wobbles away outside off, du Plessis thought about having a dip at it before belatedly letting it pass
fuller than a good length and swings away outside off again, Henry wants the two slips to come into play. Du Plessis doesn't. No shot

Henry makes du Plessis play and beats the outside edge. Good length, angling in close to off as du Plessis wafts at it. But the ball straightens away so very late to skip past the outside edge. Excellent bowling from Henry
Henry drags his length back, this keeps coming into Faf with the angle and cramps him for room. He awkwardly fends the ball to the off side off the back foot
on a length and moving away with the angle, not close enough to off to draw a stroke from Faf. End of a maiden from Henry
full and wide outside off, 142ks, Amla reaches out for the ball and carves to deep third man
pitched up and outside off, 137ks, du Plessis reaches out for a drive, but the ball wanders away to the leg side via a soft inside edge
keeps it full, attacks off stump now, du Plessis drives firmly but can't get it past mid-off
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, 145ks, Faf drives away from the body again and carves the ball fine of deep third man
shorter and outside off, Ferguson cranks it up to 145kph Amla jumps and jabs the ball away to the left of short cover
... but this is full and outside off, Amla threads the gap at point and reaches 8000 ODI runs. He's the second fastest to the landmark behind Kohli
on a length and outside off, driven on the up, just wide of Williamson at mid-off. He can't throw down the stumps either. A single is the outcome
on a length and floats away outside off, Amla simply shoulders arms
pitched up and on a fourth-stump line, Amla drives and finds mid-off
Williamson has deployed men at short midwicket and mid-on, but Amla hops, skips, and fends this short ball that is aimed at his body into that very gap
Henry hits a hard length on off, Faf covers up the line and defends back to the bowler
pitched up on off, right in Faf's driving radar. He stretches out and drives serenely past the non-striker and straight of mid-on to push SA past 50
back of a length and outside off, 146ks, Amla throws his hands at the ball and winds up mis-hitting it right back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, 147ks, Amla gets on top of the bounce and beautifully punches it away to the left of backward point and right of deep third man for three
really full on middle, Faf drills a drive but can't get it past mid-on

back of a length and outside off, 148ks, this pings into the boundary off the middle of the bat. The weight is on the back foot as du Plessis punches through the line - to the right of short cover and left of mid-off
typical fast bowler's response after being hit for a boundary. Bouncer, 149ks, aimed at the head. Faf keeps his eyes on the ball and rocks his head out of the way

Ferguson yorks du Plessis. How do you even play this? Ferguson follows the 149ks bouncer with a 148ks missile at the blockhole. The short ball and the bouncer pushed Faf back. This one clatters into off stump. Ferguson aces the 1-2. Just too quick for Faf
floats it up outside off, swings away further, no shot
overpitched and outside off, driven through the line to sweeper cover
good length and holds its line outside off, Markram spars at it and... misses
short and wide outside off, slashed away to cover-point
full and wobbles away late outside off, Markram covers his off stump and ignores it
floated full and swings away outside off, left alone once again, barely carries to Latham who is standing back
bouncer, angling in at 143ks, Amla drops his gloves and sways his upper body out of the way
short and wide outside off, 143ks again, Amla plays a long way away from the body. Has a mighty slash at it and watches the ball skip past the bat
back of a length and angling into Amla's back-foot defensive to the covers. They hare across for the single, taking on Santner's arm
full and speared in at off, 149ks, Markram closes the bat-face, and jabs the ball down to mid-on

pitched up and outside off, not quite a half-volley, but Markram leans into it and languidly drives it away to the left of short cover. Gorgeous front-foot drive - as gorgeous as his trademark back-foot punch
Ferguson runs in hard and hits the pitch harder. Lifter, angling in, and straightening away outside off. Markram has a lazy waft at it and is beaten on the outside edge
full and outside off, nibbles away, at least 25kph slower than Ferguson, Amla lets it go
off-stump yorker at 125ks, Amla jams his bat down on it and the ball rolls to cover
full and on off, barely 125ks now, Amla bunts it away towards mid-on
shorter and outside off, Amla camps back and flashes to backward point
full and on off, possibly an offcutter, the batsman is early into a drive and ends up spooning it away to the right of de Grandhomme
on a length and outside off, de Grandhomme finds awayswing, this leaves Markram and beats the outside edge. When he finds movement, de Grandhomme could be quite a handy option
drifts in outside off, full, driven to the covers off the front foot
tossed up outside off, this non-turner is eased down to long-off off the front foot
slower through the air, on a length on off, Markram hangs back and forces the ball down to long-on
on the pads, Amla whisks it away to short midwicket
on a length, hint of turn for Santner, driven with the break to the off-side sweeper
looped up on off, Markram is right forward to smother it and close out the over

shorter and hoops back into Amla, who is on the back foot, flicking and missing. The ball was doing too much to threaten the stumps. Latham reckons it was bouncing too much. The tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump
shorter and outside off, slashed away behind point
back of a length and outside off, punched up to cover
much fuller, another inswinger, it has Markram falling over the flick and playing around his front pad, but this is heading down leg
full on the stumps, defended
full and holds its line outside off, Markram chases a big cover drive and nicks an inside edge to the leg side
skidding into leg stump, back-foot punch down to long-on
tossed just a shade outside off, driven to Taylor at short cover
sliding in with the arm, clipped to short midwicket's left with that incoming angle
slower through the air, on a length on middle, Amla stays leg-side of the ball and drops a single in front of point
flighted on off, Markram presses forward and blocks it back
Santner keeps it tight at off stump, Markram responds with an equally tight forward defence
full, a bit of inward wobble as it angles in towards off and middle. Looks to punch straight, goes to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
full on middle stump, clipped away to deep square leg
full again, on middle stump. Gets his front leg out of the way and drives firmly back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, stays on the crease and a touch leg-side of the ball to block into the point region
back of a length outside off, takes a big back-and-across step, looks to punch towards mid-on, doesn't really middle it. The bowler moves across to his right to stop it
back of a length, a bit of width, slapped fiercely but straight to deep point
length ball on off stump, stays back and whips it to long-on with a lot of bottom hand
slower now, length ball close to off stump. Props forward, lets it come on, and dabs gently into the covers for a quick single
nice length, angling in towards off stump, defended down the pitch, towards the non-striker
a bit fuller, angling into middle stump. Gets his front pad out of the way and blocks it back where it came from
back of a length, homing in on the top of off stump. Makes a bit of room and jabs to the right of backward point
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and carves to backward point
length ball on off stump, defended towards backward point
big step down the pitch and across his stumps, whips this full one from outside off to mid-on, and takes off in a hurry

fullish, is that sliding down leg? Bit of an appeal, but no review once the umpire gives it not out. Steps out of the crease, looks to whip through the leg side, the ball slides past his inside edge. Was probably missing leg
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point
length ball on off stump, whipped into the square leg region. The fielder has to come in a long way off the boundary and that gives them time to sprint two
full on middle stump, whipped to long-on

not quite as full this time, and the attempted whip to long-on is intercepted by Williamson diving left from short midwicket. Gets on his feet super quick and Markram has to hurry to beat the throw home at the non-striker's end
length ball close to off stump, jabbed into the point region
flat length ball on leg stump. Looks to push to long-on again, can't get it far enough of the bowler, who throws himself to his right to stop it

overpitched. Gives it a bit of air and loses his length, bowls a half-volley on off stump, and Markram brings all the power of his bottom hand into this drive to beat the diving bowler and beat long-on to his left
tossed up slow on off stump, better length, stretches out to defend towards short extra
back of a length close to off stump, whipped to mid-on

length ball close to off stump, stops on the pitch a little as Amla looks to drive on the up. Hits the inside half of the bat and rolls slowly towards short extra-cover. Wanted to drive to that fielder's left
short now, and again the ball stops on Amla. Wants to slap to deep point, ends up dragging it to short extra
shot. Goes full now, and he leans forward to whip this from outside off, over mid-on. There's a deep midwicket in place to mop up
full again, and this time he doesn't whip it in the air as much. It's just out of reach of mid-on throwing himself to his right, and it runs away quickly to bring up Amla's fifty
short outside off, carved to deep point
full on off stump, driven inside-out to the left of extra-cover
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and eases it towards deep point. That brings up South Africa's 100
flat, angling into the pads. Whipped firmly but can't beat short fine leg
nicely bowled. Gets a bit of in-drift towards middle stump. Wants to drive inside-out through  the covers, ends up hitting it back to the bowler
wide length ball, carved away to deep point
length ball on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the right of the off-side sweeper
full outside off, driven to the sweeper at deep cover point
short, rising ball, angling in towards middle stump. Gets square-on, lets it come on, and defends towards midwicket with soft hands
shortish on middle and off. Hops to ride the bounce and dab with soft hands into the cover region
bouncer over off stump, and it rises comfortably over head height. Markram just leans across to let it pass over his left shoulder
in the blockhole on off stump, blocked solidly to mid-off, ensuring his feet aren't in the way

short outside off, gets off his feet to get on top of the bounce, and rolls his wrists over to keep the cut down. Guptill, diving left from backward point, gets a hand to it, but can't fully stop the ball, which rolls gently through the outfield
nicely tossed up on middle stump, not full enough to drive, blocked back to the bowler
down the track now and Santner drifts one into his pads, to try and deny him swinging room. Looks to flick, ends up playing towards short fine leg off the inside half of the bat
shortish on off stump, rocks back and flat-bats to long-on

bowled him, that's slightly loose from Amla. Good ball from Santner, though, hits an excellent length and spins from middle stump to hit top of off. Amla, though, was trying to stay leg-side of the ball and play that with an open face, looking to dab into the point region, which is a risky shot if all you're looking for is a single
full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, makes room for the push to deep point
hits a good length, gets a bit of inward nip to beat the inside edge of the attempted flick. Ricochets off the pad towards backward point, was probably missing leg stump
digs this in short, and surprises Markram with extra bounce. Fends at it and the ball pops up slightly, but to the right of midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the backward point region
back of a length again, this time he punches it in front of square, to the man at deep point
full outside off, nice stride forward, nice-looking drive, but straight to extra-cover
shortish, angling into off stump, turns his wrists on top of the bounce to play it down to midwicket
tossed up close to off stump, presses forward and eases it into the point region
tossed up slow on off stump, driven firmly to cover

shot! Tosses it up again and gives away a bit of width, but Markram still had to pierce the field with his drive - a cover, a short extra-cover, a sweeper square at cover point. He opens his bat face a bit to split cover and deep cover point.
tossed up full on off stump, clipped away to long-on
flat, angling down leg, tickled away past the left glove of the keeper
flat and fairly full on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover

Boult, of all fielders, drops a catch. Wouldya believe it? He has misjudged this. He runs across to his left from deep square leg, the ball comes at him at a rather awkward height, but Boult makes life difficult for him by leaping. Both his feet are in the air as he goes for the catch with both hands. The ball ultimately pops out of his hands. Boult was never stable and Markram gets away with that airy pull off a hip-high short ball
fuller and outside off, chipped into the covers
shorter and outside off, Rasssie gets on top of it and laces it away to sweeper
back of a length and swings back in to beat the inside edge and lob into the pad-flap
short and veering down the leg side, tickled away to fine leg
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to cover
short and angling across off from over the stumps, deftly run down to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, Markram stretches out, gets on top of it and laces it away to the left of short cover and right of sweeper
full and wide again, Markram has a proper go at it and scythes it away to sweeper cover
length ball, slower offcutter, Rassie waits for the ball to arrive, then taps to point
overpitched on off, looks like another slower ball, 110ks, Rassie drills it so straight that it knocks off the bails at the other end
Boult bangs a bouncer, angling down the leg side, Markram simply lets it go for a wide
back of a length and outside off, the bat turns in Markram's hands as he wafts this away into the leg side
fuller and outside off, Rassie lets the ball to slide off the face down to deep third man
slower short ball outside off, flapped away towards mid-on

Markram runs down the track to de Grandhomme and skews a catch to sweeper cover. Markram ventures down the pitch, de Grandhomme pulls his length back, and this nips away slightly outside off. Markam looks to swat it away over the leg side, but ends up splicing it to sweeper, where Munro runs in and snaffles it with a reverse-cup
pitched up and outside off, driven to long-off
fuller and angling across off, patted to mid-on off the front foot
full and outside off, lashed to mid-off
back of a length and slanting across off from over the stumps, slapped straight to backward point
shorter and angling across off, dragged towards the midwicket region off the inside half
fullish and on middle, Miller clears his front leg and drills the ball to mid-on
Miller rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and gets this behind Guptill at point. Third man mops up in the outfield
full and finishes on the pads, knocked into the leg side for one
back of a length and slanting into the pads, Miller can't put it away with a flick and the drink will taste sweeter for NZ
full and floats away outside off, Rassie reaches out for the moving ball and scoops it over extra-cover
slower ball - slower than de Grandhomme's usual stuff. Short and wide outside off, Rassie reaches out again and toe-ends it to point
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick in front of square. Rassie comes back for the second
short and outside off, Rassie allows the ball to come onto him, then glides it away to point
Rassie plays around his front pad and inside-edges this full inswinger from de Grandhomme
back of a length and around off, Rassie nurdles it away to the leg side
wide of the crease, short and outside off, 137ks, Rassie cuts and inside-edges the ball past the leg stump
full and a bit too straight from Ferguson as Miller tucks this 145ks dart to deep midwicket
on a length and outside off, quite possibly a slower ball, run away towards point
full-toss on off, 143ks, rushes Rassie, flapped to mid-on off the inside half
short, wide, flayed away to deepish mid-off. Williamson can't throw down the stumps
cross-seam bouncer, angling away, nearly rips out Miller's glove as he fends at it. The ball dribbles away behind square on the off side
pumped over mid-on inside the circle. Henry chases it hard and hauls the ball into play inches inside the rope. On a length and outside off, Miller goes over the top
slower offcutter, worked away through square leg
floated on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Rassie opens the bat-face and slides it to short third man
hip-high short ball on middle, Rassie swivels on the back foot and swats it away to deep square leg
tip and run in front of mid-off
on a length and angling across off, holds up in the pitch, Miller aims leg side, goes hard at the ball and watches a leading edge drop safely in front of cover
back of a length, pitches on leg stump, moves away and kicks up, pinging Miller on the glove once again
short at the body, cramps Miller for room, fended away to long leg
fullish and outside off, 126ks, this slower ball is tipped into the covers
dug in short on middle, fended back to Ferguson
back of a length and dragged down the leg side for a wide
yorker, dips at leg stump, jammed to midwicket

back of a length and angling across off, Rassie sizes it up and cracks it away. This seems destined to ping the boundary until Munro throws himself to his right from sweeper and intercepts the ball. No boundary yet in this partnership
little offcutter from Boult, 116ks, run down to deep third man
shorter and outside off, gets on top of it and punches out to sweeper cover
inswinging yorker from wide of the crease, from over the stumps, nearly floors Miller. He somehow jams his bat down and squirts the ball to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, jabbing punch to extra-cover
shorter and angling across off, Rassie smears it away to sweeper cover
on a length and drifts in around off, Rassie stays leg-side of the ball and forces it to cover
speared into the blockhole at off, squeezed back to Santner
arm ball, Rassie can't flick it away, heading down the leg side
short, slow, spins away, flayed away to sweeper
tossed on middle, driven down to long-off
back of a length and outside off, slapped down to long-off
length ball, angling into leg stump, nudged away through square leg
slower length ball angling away into a fifth-stump line. Goes for the angled-bat drive and misses
slower ball again, short this time. Looks to pull, plays too early. Ball pops off his body (shoulder? stomach?) into the gully region
full outside off, driven to the left of extra-cover
fullish close to off stump, driven to deep point
bouncer outside off, thinks of the pull but realises the bounce is too steep for that, and leaves it alone in the end
full on the pads, clipped to the left of deep midwicket
tossed up, and ends up too full. Van der Dussen pounces on the error in length, gets down low, onto his back knee, for a big heave over long-on
flat, speared into the pads, clipped into the midwicket region
flat and full on middle and leg, clipped back to the bowler, who dives to his left to stop it
tossed up slower, on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball to drive to long-off
short and wide, stops on the pitch, slapped along the ground to deep point
slower short ball on middle stump, helped round to fine leg
slower short ball, angling across into a fourth-stump line, and the ball grips and stops on Miller, who wants to pull, but is early on his shot, so he checks it and plays it back towards the bowler
another slower bouncer, the line is more leg-stumpish. Swings through the pull too early and misses
full on off stump, driven to long-off
short, quite a fair way outside off, drags a pull out to deep  square leg
length ball outside off, flat-batted to the right of extra-cover
low full-toss at the pads, clipped neatly, excellent timing, to the right of deep square leg

misses out. On the shorter side of a length, but plenty of width, and he slaps it straight to extra-cover. There's an appeal for a run-out at the non-striker's end... VDD had raced out of his crease, and was sent back by Miller. Makes it home with a sprawling dive by the time Boult collects and breaks the stumps

short, rising ball over off stump, pulled hard into the turf, and the man at midwicket moves to his right to stop it. It's towards Santner's wrong hand, and they take on the quick single. Santner's throw misses anyway, with Miller diving to complete the run
on middle stump, gives himself room and pushes into the covers

shot. That's very well played. Boult's angling this full ball into leg stump, looking to deny Miller room to free his arms, but Miller clears his front leg, and makes light of the lack of room with a bottom-hand shovel that carries all the way over the straight midwicket boundary
short slower one, pulled to deep square leg
shortish, angling across to off stump. It isn't that short, actually, but he's picked the length super early and swivelled through a flat pull to the forward square leg boundary
too straight, whipped off the pads to the fine leg boundary. Fine leg was up, so not the greatest line to bowl
slower ball, angling away from off stump, gets on the front foot to drive to the right of extra-cover
slower length ball outside off, opens his bat face and steers to the right of third man

makes himself plenty of room and Ferguson bangs in a short ball, slanting away from Miller. The ball is rising steeply, and he's moving away from it's line, so he can't quite control the uppercut, ends up offering a catch to third man moving to his left. Good innings, though. He's given South Africa a bit of momentum
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, helped away through backward square leg, looking for the gap rather than for power - he was looking for two from the moment he played it
length ball, fifth-stump line, Phehlukwayo flashes a drive without moving his feet and can't make contact. Was looking to hit that through cover point
looks for the leg-stump yorker, gets a bit of inward reverse but the line's a little too straight. Tickled down to fine leg, not sure if it was bat or boot

extra bounce from a short length. Ends up cramped for room trying to pull a shoulder-high ball, ends up gloving it into his helmet grille. Ouch. Out comes the physio to check on van der Dussen's right thumb. A liberal application of magic spray
and he absolutely smashes this. Poor ball from Boult, half-volley on off stump, and he clears his front leg, leans back, and wallops this between the umpire and the non-striker
full on middle stump, fuller than the previous ball so he doesn't have the same room to hit it. Driven past the stumps at the other end but this time long-on can move around to stop it
in the blockhole, trying to follow the batsman outside leg stump as he looks to make room. Tries to stab it into the off side but it beats his inside edge
slower short ball on off stump, helped round to the left of fine leg, brings up his half-century. It's been a good innings so far, keeping his scoring rate up despite not getting a lot of boundaries
bouncer, gets up over head height and Phehlukwayo misses the pull
excellent slower one, doesn't miss the top of leg stump by much after Phehlukwayo clears his front leg, slogs, and misses

gone. Mid-off was in the circle, and he gets a full-toss from Ferguson, but it's at an awkward height, about two-thirds of a stump high, and it's quick - 144kph - so he's denied swinging room. Goes hard at it, the ball comes off the bat with a dull clunk, and Williamson takes an easy chest-high catch at mid-off
shortish in the corridor, hits the pitch hard and straightens to beat the outside edge of Morris' attempted dab to third man
beaten again. Makes a lot of room to try and slash over point, but this shortish one, over middle stump, is mid-140s again, and he's a touch late on the shot
slower length ball on off stump. Looks to make room to chop it into the off side, but ends up inside-edging it and it bounces into the turf by his feet

length ball on off stump, and Rassie puts it away. Clears his front leg and hoicks it over the square leg boundary. Dragged it much squarer than intended, off the inner half, but the square boundary on that side is pretty short

slower short ball, angling into the body, and that's dropped on the fine leg boundary. Pulled in the air, and Ferguson, coming in off the boundary and sliding forward on his knees, is in a good position to take it above his lap, but he spills it despite getting both hands under it
digs it in, back of a length, must have been the slower one, and Morris, looking to make room to free his arms, can only flat-bat it down the ground to long-on
slower ball, fullish and fairly wide of off. Looks to go down on his back knee and heave it over midwicket, but he swings too early and only manages to send an inside-edge rolling to the keeper
another slower one, shorter and closer to off stump. Grips the turf and keeps a little low, and van der Dussen ends up swinging above it, looking to pull
another slower one, fuller this time, but again wide of off stump. Van der Dussen looks to reverse-sweep, but can't connect yet again
maybe they can. Short one, gets up to shoulder height outside off. Morris looks to fetch a pull from there, ends up top-edging it to the fine third-man boundary
he wants to make room and go over mid-off, but this is quick and banged in short, so it rises above his attempt at a flat-bat hit over mid-off
makes room again and Ferguson attempts to follow him with a back-of-a-length slower ball. Too early into his flat-bat hit, and it rolls to mid-off off the toe end
now Rassie makes a lot of room, and Ferguson bowls another slowie - the legcutter is his go-to variety - pretty full outside off. Big swing, looking to go over mid-off, and he misses
wham, that sounded so good off the bat. Looks to make room again, and Ferguson goes short. But it sits up at chest height, within the batsman's hitting arc, and he absolutely hammers it over long-on

great finish from van der Dussen. Looks to make room again, and this time Ferguson tries to go full. Doesn't get it full enough, and he can get underneath it and drive it hard, back over the bowler's head. Mid-off is up, and long-on is too wide, so it runs away for four to edge South Africa past 240
full, angling in at off, and swinging away a wee bit, Guptill pokes towards backward point, where the fielder swoops down on the ball
on a length and angling into the pads, Guptill flicks it and finds square leg
back of a length and slanting into middle at 142ks, Guptill drops the ball behind square leg and gets across to the other end
hang up the caution, NZ! Very full and angling across off, Munro spanks it through the line. Latches onto the width and utterly batters it through the covers
shorter and closer to off stump, Munro was ready for it. He stands up tall and strongly punches it between covers and mid-off
Rabada hits a hard length outside off, Munro punches once again, this time he can't pierce the off-side infield

welcome back, Ngidi. On a length, angling in, bouncing at off, tricks Guptill into playing the incoming angle. But this hits the pitch and wickedly straightens past the outside edge. Cracker first-up from Ngidi
pitched up, hint of away movement, squirted away to cover
shortish and outside off, glided down to deep third man for one
back of a length and on a fifth-stump line, not enough width for Munro to free his arms. Gets an inside edge that rolls away past the leg stump
on a length and outside off, driven on the rise to the left of short cover
back of a length and angling down the leg side, no shot, leg-side wide
full inswinger from wide of the crease, Guptill flicks and manages an inside edge to the leg side

Rabada has Munro caught and bowled. Banged in short from round the wicket, tucks up Munro for room, and rushes him for pace. Munro hops and inside-edges the ball onto his pad. The ball balloons in the air. Rabada runs in from his followthrough and gobbles it up to lift SA
back of a length and angling into middle from over the wicket, Williamson shuffles across a touch and defends it
back of a length and slanting in at off, Williamson deftly drops the ball in front of square leg and calls his partner through for a well-judged single
short at the body, tickled down to long leg for one
shortish and shoved down the leg side, the angle takes it away further, good grab from de Kock down the leg side. Wide
dug in short on off, fended away to the leg side to close out the over
short and skids back in at 146ks to beat the inside edge and ping Williamson on the midriff

Ngidi spins around for an lbw appeal. Umpire Llong does not budge, Faf decides against a review. Length-ball inswinger, Guptill plays around his front pad. Possibly heading down leg. Yup, misses leg stump by a long way, according to ball-tracking
fuller and outside off, Guptill slices a drive between covers and mid-off
good length and homing in at off, Guptill responds with a forward defence
back of a length and angling in at off, jabbed away to cover
full and nipping in at leg stump again, Guptill is rooted to the crease as he misses this as well
back of a length on off, guided to cover
short and largely holds its line outside off, wide outside off, 141ks, Williamson has a stab at it and inside-edges it behind
back of a length and outside off, diffused to the covers
fuller and angling down the leg side, deflected away fine of long leg
shorter and outside off, run away towards point
back of a length and straightening outside off, Williamson reaches out for the ball and is beaten on the outside edge
shorter and just a shade outside off, Williamson leaps and drops it dead
on a length and outside off, Guptill walks down at the bowler, he has a mighty whooooosh at it.. and misses. It wasn't too far away from the off stump
half-volley on the pads, picked up and dispatched to the midwicket boundary. Duly flicked away
back of a length and Ngidi hits the deck, Guptill defends to cover with the bottom hand flying off the bat
ooooof, this is Guptill at his best. Fuller on middle, he presses forward, shows the full face of the bat and drives it stylishly to the left of Rabada
if you'd missed the previous ball, worry not. Here's the replay. Pitched up further and outside off, Guptill presses forward and creams it straight of mid-off
on the pads, glanced away towards long leg
short and sliding in at the top of off, blocked off the back foot
lifter outside off, Guptill swerves out of the way
short and angling in at middle, tipped to the covers
back of a length on off, guided off the face to backward point
kicks up from a back of a length, 145kph, Guptill rises with it and fends it off
full-toss slanting in at leg stump, tucked away to midwicket's right. Rassie dives and keeps it to one
short and angling in at top of off stump, Guptill goes on the back foot and punches back to the bowler
on a length ad wide outside off, Guptill doesn't meet the pitch, simply throws his hands, and mis-hits it back to the bowler
on a length and around off, Guptill deploys a short stride and pushes the ball to cover
off-stump yorker, squirted away to cover
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Guptill shows off his high elbow and punches to mid-off
on a length and outside off, holds up in the pitch, Guptill checks his shot and instead chips it over the covers. Smart stroke from Guptill
short of a good length and outside off, Williamson gets on top of the bounce and serenely punches in the gap at the covers
on a length and holds its line outside off, nothing doing from Guptill
good length, angling in and straightening around off, run away to cover
back of a length and just a shade outside off, patted to cover
fiery bouncer outside off, 143ks, Guptill sways his upper body out of the way
much fuller on off, driven past the left of the diving bowler to mid-off. Rabada got a hand to it and took some pace off the ball
back of a length and angling in at off, defended
short and sits up outside off, Guptill hoists it over cover
full and slanting into middle and leg, Guptill jumps across off and blocks to short midwicket
back of a length and angling in at off, Guptill defends to cover off the back foot
shorter and angling in at middle, an inside edge trickles away in front of square
on a length and holds its line on off, Guptill solidly blocks to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
back of a length outside off, waits for it to come to him and steers to third man
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to guide it to third man
length ball outside off, nice press forward to ease a drive to deep point
length ball angling in towards middle stump, defended to midwicket. Kept a touch low and he did well not to play across it
short outside off, stops on the pitch and the attempted cut turns into a flat-bat hit, along the ground, to mid-off
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Williamson shapes for the back-foot punch but he's cramped for room, and he ends up defending into the covers instead

ooh, good ball. Back of a length, straightens along an off-stump line. Opens up Williamson a little in defence, and the ball hits the outside edge high on the bat and is in the air briefly on its path towards backward point

beautiful. Full, though not a half-volley, angling into off stump. Williamson brings his bat down as straight as humanly possible, showing a bat face as full as possible, and caresses it between the bowler and mid-off
back of a length, close to off stump, just lets the ball meet his downward-facing defensive bat and it rolls away to third man. Trademark Williamson
length ball on off stump, presses forward to block to cover
short, sits up nicely outside off for the pull, and van der Dussen sprints round to his left from deep square leg and puts in a slide to stop the ball
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length, a little bit of width, punched firmly but within range of backward point, who falls to his right to stop the ball

full, angling in towards off stump. Again it stops on the pitch and Guptill drives a little early, looking to go through mid-off or cover, and the ball hits the inside half and rolls away through midwicket
length ball nipping in towards off stump, a bit of extra bounce. He's on the front foot and a little cramped in the end. Drops his bottom hand to defend into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly but short extra-cover tumbles to his right and appears in the ball's path
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
ooh, beauty. Late movement from Morris in the fourth-stump channel. Hits the seam on a fullish length, and Williamson, drawn forward to defend, is beaten on the outside edge
back of a length, angling into off stump, tucked away gently to the left of midwicket
full on off stump, nice stride forward for a defensive push to mid-off

fullish outside off, nice stride forward for a checked drive to the right of Rabada sweeping on the cover point boundary. Fumbles as he's about to pick up - was in a hurry to pick up and throw - and they run a second comfortably
length ball on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
fullish outside off, opens his bat face for a punch to backward point
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-on
a touch too full outside off, and Williamson leans into an effortless drive that bisects mid-off and short extra-cover
back of a length, not quite short enough to pull. Gets up to about stump height and he drags it away to the right of fine leg, off the bottom edge. An ungainly boundary to follow a pristine one
fullish, on the pads, clipped to the left of fine leg
short outside off, rocks back to cut it away to deep point

digs it in short on off stump, gets it up to shoulder height, and Guptill has trod onto his stumps! Swivels to hook it, doesn't quite control it, but that's the least of his worries as he loses his footing and slides into the stumps
tossed up outside off, stretches out to push into the covers
a little fuller, reaches out to drive and short extra dives left to stop it
a skip down the track to the middle-stump ball, clips it down to long-on
tossed up, uses his wrists to whip it down to long-on
back of a length, wrong'un spinning in from outside off. Stops on Williamson as he goes back to punch down the ground, and the ball pops up and falls juust short of the tumbling Tahir
flat, on the stumps, defended towards midwicket

full, angling down leg, and Morris strikes in unlikely fashion! Looks to flick it away, but only manages a thin tickle through to de Kock. The luck's been on South Africa's side for the last couple of overs, and suddenly this is anyone's game!
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone
similar delivery, angling across, leans forward and steers with an open face towards third man
fullish, angling in towards off stump, presses forward and defends into the on side
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of deep point
excellent length, pitching on about off stump and continuing with the angle away. Latham is half-forward, just pokes at it hesitantly, and is lucky not to edge it
ooh, not short enough for the back-foot punch, and the ball spins away sharply and Williamson gets a thick outside edge, flies away to the right of slip
floated up slow outside off, Williamson looks to whip to long-on, but hits it straighter than he'd like, and the bowler fields it to his right
flatter, fairly full, blocked back to the bowler
flat length ball on leg stump, goes back - playing the trajectory rather than the length, and brings his bat down hurriedly to defend. Off the inside edge into the leg side
tossed up wide of off, big legbreak, Williamson plays an uncharacteristic slog-sweep at it, and misses
flat legbreak, pitching on an excellent length and spinning from leg to off. Stays on the back foot and defends

Morris is on fire! Latham's been very uncertain against his right-arm-over angle, and this one's just back of a length, pitches on leg stump and seams away slightly to kiss the outside edge as Latham looks to defend off the back foot
lovely length, pitches within the line of the stumps and slants away, isn't more than half a foot outside off stump after Neesham leaves it
ooh, past the edge again. Back of a length, and the line is so good, so close to off stump, forcing Neesham to play, and he has a poke and misses
bouncer, angling across and rising neck-high over off stump. Keeps his eyes on it and sways away from the line
shot! That's a good-length ball, but this one slants into a pretty wide line and allows him to free his arms. Stands tall and slaps it away between backward point and cover point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up on leg stump, presses forward and defends into the on side
tossed up slow on middle and off, nice stretch forward to block to short extra-cover

back of a length on off stump, punches past a diving short extra but mid-off moves quickly to his left to stop it. A bit of confusion between the two batsmen when the ball goes past the first fielder, but no harm done
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
nicely floated up across the left-hander, lands on a good length outside off. Presses forward, defends with soft hands into the cover point region
flat length ball on middle stump, goes back and shows the full face for a push to long-on
shorter and just a shade outside off, Neesham chops behind point and gets off strike
pitched up and outside off, Williamson brings out a regal on-drive. Shows the full face of the ball and caresses it away straight of mid-on. And the slip has been pulled out
shorter and on the hips, Williamson gently turns it around the corner
shorter and angling across off, Neesham allows the ball to come onto him, then steers to deep third man
lifter on middle, 138ks, Williamson ducks under it
on a length and just a shade outside off, Williamson loves that little dab down to third man, doesn't he?
pushed through outside off, not much turn either way, Williamson stretches out and pushes to cover
slower through the air and hung up outside off, dips, and Williamson smothers it away
dangles a legbreak outside off, driven with the turn down to long-off
wrong'un, full and breaks away outside off, Neesham slices it away towards point
full and outside off, pushed through the cover-point region
shorter and spins away outside off, Williamson has all the time in the world to skip back and slap it away to deep point
fuller and angling into middle, Williamson shuffles across off stump and defensively works the ball to short midwicket
on a length and outside off, Ngidi finds some extra bounce. Williamson top-edges a cut to deep third man
short and outside off from round the stumps, Neesham gets on top of it and secures a single down to deep third man
A lot of teams these days have a floating slip for Williamson. SA don't though. So, Williamson rides the bounce of this short ball and steers to deep third man
risky from Neesham for just one run. On a length and holds its line outside off, Neesham searches for a dab of his own and tickles it away to the left of Amla at first slip
no slip for Williamson, he knocks another single down to deep third man
back of a length and on middle and leg, punched off the back foot to the left of deep midwicket
pushed through outside off, driven through the line to short cover by <s>TJN</s> Neesham
Neesham has missed a full ball that dips late, and SA go up for an lbw appeal. De Kock reckons it pitched outside leg. Indeed, and it was just too full for the sweep. Bad shot selection from Neesham
stabbed back to the left of the bowler
tossed outside off, drilled to the covers
slower through the air and outside off, defended off the front foot
back of a length and slanting in at off and middle, played back to the bowler
overpitched and outside off, caressed away but straight to mid-off
slower cutter from Ngidi, grips and keeps low, beats 'em all ends up
on a length and outside off, driven sweetly but can't beat mid-off again
shorter and outside off, Williamson jumps on top of it and lashes to point
back of a length and outside off, forward and punched down to mid-off. Ngidi rounds off a maiden
pushed through on off, tip and run in front of point
looped up and outside off, shovelled away with the turn, but Markram throws himself to his left from short cover and stops the ball
darted down the leg side, Tahir gets away as Williamson sweeps straight to short fine leg
back of a length on middle, punched down to long-on
big-turning legbreak from Tahir. Starts outside off and breaks back in. Neesham has an almighty slog-sweep at it and misses it altogether
shorter and spins in, allows Neesham to defend off the back foot
short and slanted in at off, Williamson sits back and defends it back to the bowler
pitched up and outside off, forward and driven through the line to mid-off
slower ball, worked away to midwicket
slower ball, short and outside off, run away behind point to deep third man
slightly overpitched on off stump, another pretty on-drive but can't get it past mid-on
Ngidi keeps rolling out these slower balls, Williamson reds the change-up and whips it away to deep midwicket
pushed through fuller and spins into the hitting arc. #UnleashtheNeesh. He drops down to one knee and slog-sweeps it with the break over midwicket
flatter and turns in, jabbed back to Tahir
darted fuller and around off, stabbed back to Tahir once again
tossed outside off, chipped in the air to short cover, where the fielder dives, but NZ still pinch a single
looks like a googly. Williamson reads it and knocks it to the leg side with ultra-soft hands
speared full on middle, Williamson punches down to long-on and reaches another fine half-century. Just a gentle raise of the bat from Williamson. NZ need him to be there till the end
shorter and angling into off, Williamson camps back and a whirl of the wrists fetches him a single to the right of mid-on
shorter and on middle, Neesham stays leg-side of the ball and guides it to point
shortish and on the hips, Neesham hangs back and forces the ball through midwicket
shorter and outside off, Williamson hops and drops it to point
Williamson gets on top of a short ball outside off and glides it away behind point and to the right of deep third man
short and skids back in to catch Williamson in a tangle. He looks to work the ball away to the leg side. Off the thigh pad and the ball rolls to the off side
drifts a slower ball down the leg side
short and shoved down leg again, tickled away towards fine leg
slower, short ball outside off, Williamson flat-bats it only as far as point. Pressure building on NZ
fullish and outside off, jabbed to mid-off
slower ball outside off, 113ks, dips under Williamson's swing and rolls through to the keeper
short and outside off, Williamson uncharacteristically throws his bat at the ball and gets away with an inside edge that runs past the leg stump
another hard-to-hit slower, short ball. Williamson tugs it away to the midwicket region
short, rising ball close to off stump. Gets off his feet to ride the bounce, manages to keep it down in front of Amla at slip
hits the deck hard again, not quite as short, lets it come and dabs with an open face towards slip, on the bounce
short again, a little wider, dabbed towards backward point, where Markram dives left to stop it
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
bouncer rising steeply over leg stump, ducks low to avoid it

bit of an appeal for caught behind. A short one at around chest height, hops up and across to try and glance it fine, and I don't know what it hit, but there was a faint suggestion of something - thigh pad? - on it. Not the most convincing appeal from de Kock, and Rabada wasn't hugely excited either
full, ends up slipping a fair way down leg. Too far from Williamson to connect with the flick
now he overcompensates with a wide one way outside off. Left alone
shortish outside off, slashes hard and hits it finer than he wants, bottom-edges it to the left of the diving Amla at wide slip/gully
bouncer, ducks low and gets under it
back of a length outside off, whipped to mid-on with a lot of bottom hand. There are only three fielders on the leg side, so a big gap at midwicket that he really wanted to hit with that shot
short outside off, gets up to shoulder height, drags a pull around to deep backward square leg
half-volley on off stump, and Neesham puts it away easily. A nice flowing drive between the umpire and non-striker, and mid-on is up
length ball angling into off stump, blocked into the covers

there's that lovely Williamson drive again, on the up, except the ball is still stopping occasionally off this pitch, and it briefly hangs in the air on its way to mid-off, making Morris put his head in his hands

gone! Steered straight to the man at wide slip! Morris' over-the-wicket angle to the left-handers has picked up another wicket. Cross-seam, just short of a length, angling away from off stump, and Neesham leans back and steers it, probably looking for third man, but the ball bounces a little more than he'd like and he ends up hitting it straight into Amla's lap. Takes it well, falling to his left
length ball, top of off, leans forward and punches to the right of deep point
what a shot. What. A. Shot. It's overpitched, yes, on middle stump, but to time it like that, wow. Flicks it, casual as you'd like, and it almost carries all the way to the square midwicket boundary
full outside off, punched into the covers off the front foot
length ball on off stump, and that's a nice-looking clip into the backward square leg region, doesn't put too much weight on that shot so the fielder has to come in quite a distance off the boundary
tossed up full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
lovely flight on off stump, drops onto a length that has CdG half-forward and groping forward with his hands to defend. Thick edge rolls into the backward point region
flat length ball on off stump, Williamson plays close to his body in defence, into the off side
middle-stump line now, gets forward to block it back to the bowler
wrong'un, goes back, stays leg-side of it - picked it easily enough - and shows the full face to pick up a single to long-on
now de Grandhomme picks the googly. Tossed up slower and fuller. Gets on the front foot and defends solidly
shortish, close to off stump, lot of bottom wrist to whip it into the midwicket region
full outside off, and de Grandhomme drives to the right of a diving backward point fielder, out to deep point
short on off stump, gets up to about chest high but stops on Williamson. Through his pull very early, and the ball hits him on the right elbow. Ouch!
shortish in the corridor, jumps to ride the bounce and punch firmly to Markram diving right from backward point

short outside off, only gets up to about waist height, and Williamson is ready and waiting, smacks a pull to the vacant midwicket boundary. Huge gap in that area given this is a 6-3 field with a slip still in
full, a bit of late inswing into the fourth-stump channel, driven smoothly to mid-off
wrong'un, fairly full and spinning into middle and leg. He probably picks it, but swings across the line, across his front pad, to hit it hard through square leg
flatter and quicker, punched down the ground, past the right hand of the diving bowler, to long-on
flighted full-toss on off stump, clipped to long-on
another low full-toss, nearly a yorker, on leg stump. Jabbed back to the bowler
again in that blockhole-ish region, more off-stumpish. Driven down to long-on

slower flight, googly, Williamson stretches forward and clips gently to the right of midwicket. A bit of hesitation from Williamson, but CdG, who's going to the danger end, is more certain, and he makes it home with a dive even as Miller swoops down and throws to the keeper
overpitched on middle and leg, clipped to deep backward square leg

You can put everyone in the world on the boundary, and it won't matter. Short ball, gets up to about chest height, and de Grandhomme is onto it so quickly, swivels and deposits it waaaaaaaay beyond the square leg boundary, up in the back rows
fuller, on the pads, clipped through backward square leg

slower length ball outside off, and Williamson is looking for that dab to third man, but the ball bounces extra, and he's suddenly unsure whether to play or leave, and it brushes his glove but bounces before it can reach the keeper
length ball outside off, lets it come and guides it to third man
back of a length outside off, punched to extra-cover

ccaaaatchh they cry, as Miller rushes to his left , trying desperately to get under the chip from Williamson. He reaches out a hand, hoping, praying, but it lands short of him! Williamson stands and watches it all, his heard beating a mile a minute, hating himself for mistiming a shot meant to go to long-on
eases it through the covers

dropped by Miller and it's another really tough chance again! De Grandhomme whips a googly off the back foot, hoping to clear short midwicket. But Miller leaps up and to his right, getting massive airtime, then he sticks out his right hand but it just doesn't stick
tosses it up on off stump, Williamson waits for it to spin and then taps it towards the off side

follows the legbreak - a mistake he doesn't normally do, but here he needs to put bat to ball and get runs, and because of that pressure, he plays a low percentage glide with half a bat and is beaten. Waaaait, replays show Williamson bottom edged it! De Kock didn't hear it. Tahir is appealing. He's shocked no one joins him and South Africa have missed out on a big big biiiiiiiiig break
nudges a back of a length delivery to the left of short midwicket
taps a shortish delivery on off stump towards mid-on
wallooppppppppppp! It's good to target de Grandhomme with the short ball. But when it's waist high, the big man can just swat it away miles over square leg
shortish on off stump, defends
steers a back of a length delivery past the left of backward point. Markram slams the turf in anger after the ball beats his outstretched hand
back of a length on middle and leg, whips it behind square leg
kicks up on Williamson, cramping him on off stump, and the New Zealand captain dabs it to the wicketkeeper's right
chops the shortish delivery outside off to point
brings his wrists into play to deal with a slower ball looking for the top of off stump. Works it to midwicket

another slower ball, and it sticks in the pitch, making Williamson's push to mid-on travel in the air for a distance. This is on a knife edge, people. South Africa can still make up for missing that review to get Williamson caught behind
full, slow and on off stump. Williamson blocks towards point. Good stuff. They realise the pitch is helping them when pace is taken of it
taps a full delivery on middle to long-on

Oh my, a comedy of errors at Edgbaston. Awful mix-up between the wickets. Miller fluffs a run-out chance and reprieves Williamson. This was another well-directed short ball at the body, comes off pretty slow off the surface. Williamson is early into the pull and wears it on his body. De Grandhomme wants a single, Williamson doesn't. Rabada, the bowler himself, swoops down on the ball. The throw is to Miller at the non-striker's end. He is in a rush. He is under pressure. He dislodges the bails without collecting the ball. What a big miss for SA. Is that the game?
fuller and outside off, no shot
good length, angling in and straightening away, takes the outside edge and runs away past de Kock to the third-man boundary. A slip might have gobbled that up
short and angling into the body, blocked to the leg side off the back foot
short and aimed at the body, fended off the back foot once again
Rabada hits a hard length outside off, de Grandhomme coolly drives off the back foot to long-off
on a length and outside off, crunched past the covers
slower short ball outside off, Williamson swings and flat-bats it to sweeper cover
dug short on middle, swatted away to deep square leg
back of a length on middle, stands tall and punches down to long-on
yorker on middle, jabbed away to deep mdiwicket for one
slower short ball outside off, Williamson swivels on the back foot and drags a pull to deep midwicket
short and outside off, difficult to put these away. Williamson taps it on its head but to the keeper
short and wide outside off, Williamson reaches out for the ball and scythes it away to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, de Grandhomme allows the ball to come on, then glides it to point
shortish and on off, de Grandhomme leans back and chops it away to point
full on the stumps, de Grandhomme is happy to sit back and punch it down to long-on
shorter and just a shade outside off, Williamson brings out the artistic dab down to deep third man
back of a length on off, chopped from the stumps wide of short third man. 200 up for NZ
slower offcutter, full and outside off, barely 115ks, de Grandhomme has a crack at it and edges it between de Kock and short third man for a fortunate four
leg-stump full-toss, whipped away to deep midwicket. de Grandhomme has been middling everything today
slower short ball around off, Williamson hauls a pull to the right of long-on and comes back for the second

Ngidi has dropped it. SA's fielding has gone to pieces. Okay, this is a beamer - well above the waist. Williamson swivels and flaps it in the air to deep backward square moving to his right. It's all happening at Edgbaston
full and outside off, this free-hit is swung away to long-on
short on the hips, quietly glanced away to square leg
nice and full, slanting into the middle of Williamson's forward defence
fullish and homing in on off, pressed to the covers
cross-seamer, back of a length and outside off, can't bowl there. You will be dabbed down to third man
back of a length and kicks up outside off, beating de Grandhomme's lazy attempt to run it down to deep third man
ripping off-stump yorker, de Grandhomme is up to it, kept out

Mowed away to the wide long-on boundary and that's fifty for de Grandhomme. Born in Harare, playing for NZ at home away from home in Edgbaston. He turns out for Birmingham Bears in the T20 tournament here. Who writes your scrips, man? What an innings under pressure. Back of a length and outside off, he swats it away like a fly
slower short ball, sticks in the surface, Kane yanks his bottom hand off the bat and scoops it away over midwicket
slower cutter, nurdled to the leg side
overpitched and outside off, Williamson shovel-drives it with his bottom wrist to the off-side sweeper
slower ball, dips under his almighty swing. Beaten lavishly, this offcutter was barely 110ks

A catching opportunity ends up as a boundary. What're you doing SA? Miller runs in, attacks the ball for the catch, but the ball drops in front of him at deep midwicket. Rabada is at the edge of the boundary running round from deep square, he slides, but lets the ball go to the fence. Back of a length and outside off, de Grandhomme smites it away and gets away
slower ball, past the tramline, wide
another slower cutter, knocked to the leg side for one
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
banged in short at off, Williamson leaps and fends it behind to the keeper
short and rises at off, Williamson rises with it and diffuses it
Williamson rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and guides it down to deep third man - like only he can
shortish and outside off, now it's CdG's turn to run it away... but third man is up to stop the single
short and outside off, slower one at 117ks, slapped through backward point

South Africa finally hang onto a catch. Faf du Plessis gives SA hope. Oh man, what a game this is turning out to be! This is the slower one once again. Pitched up and outside off, right up the alley for de Grandhomme to muscle it into the stands. He only holes out to long-off. Is there another twist in this match?
Has that been dropped by Ngidi? Nope, that did not carry to him and he wears a wry smile. Slower cutter, grips in the pitch, chipped back, lands just in front of the bowler
pitched up and outside off, Williamson shovels it away with the bottom hand to wide long-on
slower offcutter, excellent execution from Ngidi from round the wicket, beats Santner. De Kock somehow grabs it awkwardly. Pressure. Pressure. Pressure. He didn't even get his body behind the ball
slower short ball outside off, swatted away to the bowler, smashes the stumps at the non-striker's and rolls down to long-on

That artistic dab from Williamson fetches him a crucial four. Slower ball, Ngidi rolls his fingers across the ball and pushes it outside off, Williamson waits for the ball to arrive, then glides it - like only he can - fine of short third man for four. First boundary for Williamson after 38 balls, I'm told. Significant one
hip-high short ball on middle, Santner pulls and finds deep midwicket

Grant Elliott: 2015. Kane Williamson: 2019. New Zealand are having the times of their lives once again. What an incredible century from Kane Williamson. This was full and outside off, slower variation, Williamson picks it, drops down to one knee and smokes it away into the stands beyond midwicket. Williamson eases the helmet off his head and soaks everything in

Williamson - you beauty! It had to end this way, right? That dab down to third man. Back of a length and outside off, glides it away behind point and seals it for NZ like boss. He is the boss. Meanwhile, South Africa's World Cup hopes are effectively ended
